intro: Stachytarpheta alata, commonly known as the winged ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, winged leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stachytarpheta alata is often found in moist, shaded areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
